curated_text: Symbol: FIS. Year: 2025. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: FIS, Cybersecurity Threats and Solutions Cyberattacks, NM, the Banking and Capital Markets, Capital Markets, Corporate, Gross Profit, Worldpay, Administrative Expenses Selling, the Worldpay Sale, NM NM, Issuer Solutions Acquisition, Company, the Worldpay Minority Interest Sale, NM Effective, Capital Market Solutions, FASB ASC Topic, 37 Table of Contents Banking Solutions, the Pound Sterling, Capital Resources Cash Requirements, Revolving Credit Facility, the Issuer Solutions Acquisition, the Board of Directors, Board of Directors, RealNet, FASB, ASU, Euro, the U.S. Dollar, the British Pound Sterling, Australian Dollar, Pound Sterling, Commission, Legal & Corporate Affairs, Plan, Exhibits Incorporated, Reference Exhibit SEC File Filed/, Global Payments, Total System Services, Fidelity National Information Services, Inc., Goldman Sachs Bank USA, the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, the Interactive Data File, the Securities Exchange Act, FIDELITY NATIONAL INFORMATION SERVICES,, INC. Context excerpt: competition among financial technology providers. However, consolidation resulting from specific merger and acquisition transactions may be beneficial to our business. When consolidations of financial institutions occur, merger partners often operate systems obtained from competing service providers. The newly formed entity generally makes a determination to migrate its core and payments systems to a single platform. When a financial institution processing client is involved in a consolidation, we may benefit if the client retains our solutions and expands the use of them following the consolidation to support the newly combined entity. Conversely, we may lose revenue if our solutions are not chosen to support the newly combined entity. It is also possible that larger financial institutions resulting from consolidation may have greater leverage in negotiating terms or could decide to perform in-house some or all of the solutions that we currently provide or could provide.
